org.ensor.math.analysis

Class ConstantFunction

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ensor.math.analysis.ConstantFunction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDifferentiable, IDifferentiableFunction<ConstantFunction>, IFunction, IVector<ConstantFunction>

    public class ConstantFunction
extends Object
implements IDifferentiableFunction<ConstantFunction>
    This class represents an interpolator which returns a constant value for the entire interval.
    Author:
    jona

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static IDifferentiableFunction ZERO
      This field represents the constant function which returns zero in all locations.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ConstantFunction(double aValue)
      The constructor creates an interpolator which returns the same value for the entire interval.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ConstantFunction add(ConstantFunction aValue)
      Returns the constant function resulting from adding this function to the given function.
      double getA()
      Returns the constant-order term.
      IDifferentiableFunction getDerivative()
      This method returns the first derivative of the function.
      double getValue(double t)
      This method returns the point value for the specified path parameter.
      ConstantFunction multiply(double aValue)
      The constant function resulting from multiplying this function by the given factor.
      ConstantFunction negate()
      Returns the constant function which is the negation of this one.
      ConstantFunction subtract(ConstantFunction aValue)
      Returns the constant function resulting from subtracting the given function from this one.

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        This field represents the constant function which returns zero in all locations.

        public ConstantFunction(double aValue)
        The constructor creates an interpolator which returns the same value for the entire interval.
        Parameters:
        aValue - The constant value of the interpolation for the interval.

    • Method Detail

      • getA

        public double getA()
        Returns the constant-order term.
        Returns:
        Returns the constant-order term.

      • getValue

        public double getValue(double t)
        This method returns the point value for the specified path parameter. The path parameter runs from 0 to 1.
        Specified by:
        getValue in interface IFunction
        Parameters:
        t - Path parameter.
        Returns:
        The point between start and end of path corresponding to this path location.

      • getDerivative

        public IDifferentiableFunction getDerivative()
        This method returns the first derivative of the function. For a constant function, this is identically the ZERO function.
        Specified by:
        getDerivative in interface IDifferentiable
        Returns:
        Exactly zero since the first derivative of a constant value is zero.

      • add

        public ConstantFunction add(ConstantFunction aValue)
        Returns the constant function resulting from adding this function to the given function.
        Specified by:
        add in interface IVector<ConstantFunction>
        Parameters:
        aValue - The function to add.
        Returns:
        The sum of the two constant functions.

      • subtract

        public ConstantFunction subtract(ConstantFunction aValue)
        Returns the constant function resulting from subtracting the given function from this one.
        Specified by:
        subtract in interface IVector<ConstantFunction>
        Parameters:
        aValue - The function to subtract.
        Returns:
        The resulting constant function.

      • multiply

        public ConstantFunction multiply(double aValue)
        The constant function resulting from multiplying this function by the given factor.
        Specified by:
        multiply in interface IVector<ConstantFunction>
        Parameters:
        aValue - The factor to multiply.
        Returns:
        The resulting function.

      • negate

        public ConstantFunction negate()
        Returns the constant function which is the negation of this one.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
